entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.41
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Codegen of string literals (#1287)

The code generator of swc tries to preserve the original input, and it resulted in some bugs. It's now fixed by a huge breaking change - storing quote info in the string literal.

Note that this patch is als...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.40
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

design;type for typescript enums (#1248)

Decorator metadata can be used to create very convenient tools. swc now supports it more correctly.

For example, the code below works with swc@1.2.40+.

enum MyEnum { x = "xxx", y = "yyy", } class Xpto...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.39
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Preserved input (#1221)

swc now respects the input, and preserves escapes.

Private name in interfaces (#1211)

swc previously aborted on input like the below. This is changed to normal error.

interface Foo { #bar(); }

Bundler rework (#1212)

...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.38
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Parenthesis with comments (#1203)

Previously [swc][] miscompiled

function isModuleWrapper(node: Expression) { return ( // It's an anonymous function expression that wraps module (node.type === "FunctionExpression" && !node.id) || nod...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.37
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

ascii-only output (#1191)

Previously [swc] emitted utf-8 output and had some bug related to escape, but[swc] now emits only ascii characters.

error instead of panic (#1170)

Previously [swc] panicked if the parse is called with the code below...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.36
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

export * as ns (#1142)

swc now handle export * as ns from 'foo'; by default, if you are targeting < es2020.

Also, spack and swc_bundler now supports it directly.

conditional expression in await (#1133)

swc errornously removed parenthesis ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.35
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

This version includes lots of bugfixes.

optional chaining (#1130)

Nested property access in optional chaining is now properly compiled.

The affected code looks like below. Notice that there's no ? before map.

let data; const result = data ?....

entry.title: Hotfix: swc v1.2.34
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

jest extension (#1106)

Previously @swc/jest errornously removed some useful statemetns.

entry.title: ChangeLog: swc v1.2.33
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

optional chaining (#1104)

This is a bug made in v1.2.31. swc miscompiled optional chaining in the arguments.

entry.title: ChangeLog: swc v1.2.32
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

codegen of jsx nodes (#1097)

This helps using a swc as a building block.

entry.title: ChangeLog: swc v1.2.31
entry.summary:
Domain change

The swc project now uses swc.rs, instead of swc-project.github.io. Thank you contributors!

Bugfixes

(spack) export * in entry (1083)

Previously, export * from './a' only worked in non-entry files. It's a common pattern to export everyth...

entry.title: ChangeLog: swc v1.2.30
entry.summary:
Documentations

.d.ts files and the documentation of swc is now consistent.

See: configuring swc

Bugfixes

spack (#1075, #1078)

  • Panic while calculating the least common ancestor.

Previously, in some cases, lca calculation resulted in a panic because ...

entry.title: ChangeLog: swc v1.2.27
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Import / export orders are preserved (#1069)

Previously swc can break codes if you use es6 circular imports. As circular imports are not used widely, it was undetected.

The affected code looks like

import "reflect-metadata"; export * from "....

entry.title: Hotfix: swc v1.2.26
entry.summary:
Hotfix

Due to a bug of the build script, unpacked size was too big. New version is published to reduce package size.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.25
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

codegen of block comment (#1062)

Previously, swc injected a newline after block comments.

This is wrong behavior, as it can break some codes. Especially, the code below is broken.

return /*****/ function () {};

It was compiled as

return /**...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.23
entry.summary:
New features

jsx pragma (#1015)

swc finally suports jsx pragma, which is required to use some libraries like emotion.sh.

// this comment tells babel to convert jsx to calls to a function called jsx instead of React.createElement /** @jsx jsx */ impor...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.22
entry.summary:
General improvements

No install script (#1009)

With napi-rs, swc becomes faster and install script is removed. npm i @swc/core is enough!

emitDecoratorMetadata checks for Reflect (#1011)

Thanks to @Brooooooklyn, swc now works just like official tsc w...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.21
entry.summary:
General improvements

Support optional named tuple elements (#982)

TypeScript 4 allows

type Foo = [first: number, second?: string, ...rest: any[]];

and swc now supports it.

Better error messages (#980)

Error messages were crpytic, mainly because I'm ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.20
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

spack respects swcrc (#964)

Spack supports .swcrc properly. Just like webpack + babel environment, the configuration is determined per-file. You can even mix tsx, ts, js if you want.

spack handles common js modules properly (#969)

Previously...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.19
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

optional constructor property parameters (#959)

Previously test? in the code below was miscompiled. It's now fixed and swc generates correct output.

export class Test { constructor(readonly test?: string) {} }

Some dce bugs (#959)

While abs...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.18
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

typescript class properties (#956)

This is a bugfix for a new feature introduced in [swc][]@v1.2.16.

An example of affected code is

class A { declare1; declare2!: string; }

typescript class properties (#954)

typescript class properties (#951)

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.15
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

emitDecoratorMetadata for parameters (#948)

Previously, swc emit wrong metadata information for decorators on parameter if decorator metadata is enabled. As a result, the code below was broken.

class MyController { @Get("/callback") callback...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.14
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

emitDecoratorMetadata for typescript decorators (#945)

Bugfix for the feature introduced at swc@v1.2.14.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.13
entry.summary:
New features

type annotation in catch binding (#942)

TypeScript 4.0 supports using unknown as a type of catch parameter, like

try { } catch (e: unknown) { }

swc now supports it.

emitDecoratorMetadata for typescript decorators (#939)

You can now use ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.12
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

computed constructors (#933)

Codes like

new (eval("Date"))();

is affected.

spack

Conditional require (#937)

You can now use spack for client-side applications, too. Previously, codes like

if (!Object.defineProperty) { require("./object-prop...

entry.title: swc v1.2.11: Fix for almost all typescript bugs
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

super statements (#918)

Thanks to @Brooooooklyn, no statement will be injected before super(). The patch affects code like

export class BadRequestError extends Error { constructor(public readonly message: string) { super(message); } }

by ma...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.10
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Error recovery for parser (#896)

export type * from "../typings";

The code above is invalid, but tsc accepts it and print an error message for it. I decided to follow the behavior of tsc and I modified the parser to accept it.

codegen of pr...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.9
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

hygiene of class properties (#892)

Previously, swc miscompiled

const DURATION = 1000; export class HygieneTest { private readonly duration: number = DURATION; constructor(duration?: number) { this.duration = duration ?? DURATION; } getDurati...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.8
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Random pacic of spack (#876)

I think it's completely fixed. The mutex mentioned in the previous post now protects both range and real values.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.7
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

crash of spack (#872)

The swc manages the span in a fairly unusual way. It manages span information by creating a global map and assigning a range in it. The global map should be protected with an atomic variable or mutex because swc support...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.6
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

catch parameter in regenerator (#854)

While porting regenerator, I forgot handling catch parameters. The bug was that swc does not touch e in the code below.

function throwingFn() { throw "Error"; } function* gen() { try { yield throwingFn()...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.2.5
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

regenerator (#851)

Previously, the code below was miscompiled by swc because of the performance optimizartion. The wrong optimization is removed and the code below now works.s

function* gen() { yield 1; } function genFactory() { return funct...

entry.title: v1.2: spack: Yet another asset bundler
entry.summary:
Features

Compact output

Just like rollup, spack emits compact output.

a.js:

console.log("loading A"); export function a() { console.log("use!"); }

lib.js

import { a } from "./a"; a();

becomes

console.log("loading A"); function a() { console.log("us...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.58
entry.summary:
Improvements

default syntax (#840)

Previosuly, options.jsc.parser.syntax was required, and

var transpiledJs = swc.transformSync(js, { minify: true, jsc: { parser: { nullishCoalescing: true, numericSeparator: true, }, }, });

didn't work as intended. ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.57
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Source map (#835)

The source map is fixed. I verified that generated source map point the original source correctly by using source map visualizer.

yield* (#833)

regenerator pass had a bug related to yield*.

Previously, swc broke code like

f...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.56
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Inline sourcemap (#832)

Previously the swc handled inlined source maps wrongly. Starting with swc@1.1.56, inline source maps are handled properly.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.55
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Sourcemap (#830)

Previously, swc ignores input source map. Starting with swc@1.1.55, input source maps are respected.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.54
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Usage of static property in decorators (#824)

import { Debounce } from "lodash-decorators"; class Person { private static debounceTime: number = 500 as const; @Debounce(Person.debounceTime) save() { console.log("Hello World!"); } } const p =...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.53
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Parser improvements (#816)

swc had a bug related to parsing of type annotations. This is fixed by the pr and swc can really parse almost all typescript codes.

class member named declare (#822)

The code below is quite simple, but need some ca...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.52
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Parser improvements (#811)

From now on, swc can parse almost all valid typescript files.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.51
entry.summary:
Integration tests

swc now compiles and run the test suite of three.js and redux as a part of ci process. I tried to add more stuffs, but the build system of other projects were too complex to make it use swc.

Bugfixes

new expression

As part of integr...

entry.title: Hotfix: swc v1.1.50
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Note: prebuilt binaries for v1.1.49 are replaced with binaries from v1.1.48, to prevent breaking downstream crates.

New reserved_words pass (#805)

I made a serious mistake at v1.1.49 which makes swc unusable. This patch fixes it.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.49
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

typescript strip pass (#800)

Previously, swc did not drop type parameters in classes. This caused

export class FeatureSet<Name extends string> { log(a: Name) { console.log(a); } }

to be compiled as

export class FeatureSet<Name exte...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.48
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

typescript casts (#794)

Previously, swc dropped the type information in casts without visiting it. It caused

import { IPerson } from "../types/types"; export function createPerson(person) { const a = {} as IPerson; }

to be compiled as

// Th...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.47
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

typescript imports (#791)

swc had a bug related to type-only imports. Problematic codes include

import { IPerson } from "../types/types"; export interface IEmployee extends IPerson {} export function createPerson(person: IPerson) { const a =...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.46
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

resolver: arrow expression (#790)

swc had a bug that occurs if an arrow parameter and local binding has a same name. Due to the bug, code like

window.addEventListener("message", (e) => { try { console.log(e.data); } catch (e) { console.lo...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.45
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

preset-env: non-swcrc config (#783)

Previously if you use transformSync without a file name, configuration related to preset-env was ignored. This is obviously wrong and it's fixed with v1.1.45.

UX Improvements

Better error message (#781)

Wh...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.44
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

preset-env: regenerator (#780)

From now on, the following code works with preset-env.

import "core-js"; async function a() { return 1; } a().then(console.log);

Performance boost

Reduced stack usage (#776)

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.43
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

New features

Decorators on parameters (#775)

The following is valid TypeScript code:

class MyClass { myMethod(@myDecorator myParameter: string) {} }

Previously, swc cannot parse this as swc did not support decorators on a parameter. Thanks ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.42
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Dead code elimination (#763)

Previously, dead code elimination pass of swc dropped some used imports. It was cause by iteration order.

In the code below,

import { A, B } from "library"; const arr = [A, B]; console.log(B); arr.map((v) => c...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.41
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Dead code elimination (#760)

Previously, dead code elimination pass of swc was buggy and removed some used codes.

The root cause was incorrect management of a state variable, and it is fixed by #762

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.40
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

@swc/register (#754)

Previously, @swc/register emitted error on normal files. This is fixed in @swc/register@0.1.7.

typescript enum (#757)

You can now export default typescript enums.

requires with es6 imports (#724)

Previously swc miscompil...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.38
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

exponential operator (#746)

Exponential operator in right-hand-side of an assignment expression now works correctly

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.37
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Deep nesting in optional chaining expression (#735)

swc can now handle codes like

test.a?.b.c.d.e.f.g.h.i;

Improvements

Starting from v1.1.37, swc accepts an input source map. inputSourceMap can be true, false,"inline" or the cont...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.36
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

TypeScript enum with key / value (#730)

Thanks to @gus3inov, swc now handles typescript enum correctly.

enum StateNum { closed = "cl0", opened = "op1", mounted = "mo2" }

await after yield (#720)

The code like below is parsed correctly.

asyn...

entry.title: Call for help and roadmap
entry.summary:
Call for help

I'm an undergraduate and while on a vacation, I could and did invest 12 ~ 14 hours to swc per day. But vacation is over and I can't afford to spend so much time. So I want some help from the community.

I welcome the contribution of any ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.35
entry.summary:
Span regressions

swc@v.1.1.34 made many changes to the parser, and it also introduced some regressions of span.

Start of arrow in conditional expression (#712)

The span of the code like

referrer ? false : ([, specifier]): string => specifier;

is ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.34
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Source maps (#705, #707)

Starting from v1.1.34, swc handles the source map correctly.

.d.ts support typescript parser

Previously, swc could not handle .d.ts files properly, as the syntax differs. I've added a feature to parse optional bindin...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.32
entry.summary:
Performance

24x faster for a large file (#697)

swc now handles large source maps correctly, and

$ time swc large.js -o dist.js -s > /dev/null swc large.js -o dist.js -s > /dev/null 16.19s user 0.24s system 100% cpu 16.295 total

becomes

$ time ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.33
entry.summary:
Hotfix

preset-env

Previsously, swc, with env config, dumped target browser list. It's now fixed and swc becomes quiet.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.31
entry.summary:
Performance

parser becomes 10% ~ 15% faster

swc uses a special technique copied from rustc to store identifers and spans compactly. However, it's memory-performance tradeoff, and encoding and decoding is not super fast operation. So, while parsing, s...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.30
entry.summary:
Bugfix

enum with initializer (#694)

Previously, swc worked well with enum without an initilaizer, but enum with initilaizer was broken. From now on, swc emits the same output as tsc for enum.

Span of assignment pattern (#693)

Thanks to @dsherret, spa...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.29
entry.summary:
Bugfix

hoisting (#689)

swc now supports declaring a var after usage.

function test() { if (typeof Missing == typeof EXTENDS) { console.log("missing"); } var EXTENDS = "test"; }

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.28
entry.summary:
Bugfix

for loops with continue (#686)

Starting from v1.1.28, swc does not break the code like

module.exports = function(values) { var vars = []; var elem = null, name, val; for (var i = 0; i < this.elements.length; i++) { elem = this.elements[i]; ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.27
entry.summary:
Bugfix

subscripts with a new.target (#675)

From now on, swc can correcrly parse the codes like

Object.setPrototypeOf(this, new.target.prototype);

nested loop (#682)

block_scoping pass of swc had a bug. Ut's fixed and nested loops work correctly.

fun...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.26
entry.summary:
Bugfix

recursive function reference within a method property (#679)

Previously, codes like below can crash swc.

({ foo() { function bar() { bar; } } });

This is fixed with @v1.1.26.

await-for loop

swc emits identical code as babel when it meets an a...

  • request is replaced with node-fetch

entry.title: Why is swc fast?
entry.summary: swc is fast. Very fast. It's 18x faster than babel on a single-core benchmark, and on a parallel benchmark, it's 68x faster than babel on a 4 core (8 HT) machine. Why? Just because it's written in rust? No. Its fundamental design differs from any oth...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.24
entry.summary:
Features

type-only imports and exports (TS 3.8) (#662)

This is enabled by default, and see https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-3-8-beta/#type-only-imports-exports for details.

Binary size reduction (#663)

Binary size is re...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.23 - hotfix
entry.summary:
Hotfix - optimizer

swc's optimizer (added in v1.1.22) previously drops exports, even if it is used. This is clearly wrong, and fixed with v1.1.23.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.22
entry.summary:
Improvements

Optimizer

swc can reduce

let b = 2; let a = 1; if (b) { a = 2; } let c; if (a) { c = 3; } console.log(c);

down to

console.log(3);

Hotfix

hygiene pass

Global variable accesses are marked with the same mark.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.21
entry.summary:
Improvements

Automatic typescript detection (#655)

As typescript support is embedded in swc by default, swc handles it out of the box.

You don't need any configuration to use typescript. Also note that It also detects tsx and automatically enables ts...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.20
entry.summary:
Improvements

Smaller runtime dependency (#631)

swc now imports regenerator-runtime instead of @babel/runtime/regenerator. This is not a breaking change because @babel/runtime depends on regenerator-runtime.

From now on, you can remove @babel/runtime ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.19
entry.summary:
New features

Optional chaining in es (#619)

Code like

a?.b?.c;

is now possible within ecmascript.

As it's stage 3, you need to set an option to use it. See the doc for the option.

top-level await (#627)

swc can parse codes like

await foo();

As it's...

entry.title: Performance comparison of swc and babel
entry.summary:
Single core world

JavaScript is single-threaded. The js thread is not a good place to do heavy computation. Let's talk about babel and swc, which are both compute-heavy.

swc repository: swc babel homepage: babel

Benchmark

Let's do a benchmark for the...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.17
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

jsx attribute (#615)

Previously, = "5" in the code below breaks swc.

let c = <Test attrib="5" />;

swc now handles it without any problem.

parsing of async generator function (#612)

swc can now parse an async generator functi...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.16
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

variable infection (#610)

Handle variable infection in the block scoping pass.

i.e. In the code below, v is 'infected' by i.

var functions = []; for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) { let v = i; functions.push(function() { return v; }); } functio...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.15
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

block scoping (#604)

swc had a serious bug bug.

swc compiled

let functions = []; for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) { functions.push(function() { console.log(i); }); } functions[0](); functions[7]();

as

var functions = []; for (var i = 0; i &l...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.14
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

throw in nested finally block (#601)

Previously,

function* foo() { try { } finally { try { } finally { throw new Error("foo"); } } }

make swc panic. swc is now ok with it.

It was really hard to create a minimal reporduction case.

use-use co...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.13
entry.summary:
Bugfixes

Class methods (#579)

There was a bug of swc that identifiers in the body of class methods are not handled by resolver pass. It results in a bug and it's now fixed.

jsx container (#584)

Previously you cannot get the span of {4}. Instead, you ...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.12
entry.summary:
AST

GetterProperty (#557)

The code below is a valid typescript file.

const obj = { get test(): string { return ""; } };

Now swc's GetterProperty has a field named typeAnnotation and swc can parse it correctly.

TsImportType (#560)

Import type havs ty...

entry.title: Introducing pmutil
entry.summary: swc uses proc macros extensively. I use a procedural macro if possible to reduce boilerplates and to avoid rewriting boilerplates when something is changed. Behind the scene, there's a hero crate called pmutil. It provides useful stuffs for proc macr...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.11
entry.summary:
AST

TsExpressionWithTypeArguments

TsExpressionWithTypeArguments has typeArguments instead of typeParams. This is technically breaking change, but I didn't bumped major version because I don't think the change break real world code.

Parser

span of imp...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.10: preset-env
entry.summary:
preset-env (#421)

swc gets ability to detect required transforms and polyfills based on target. Target includes browser with specific version ("chrome 49"), or complex query ("last 2 versions").

{ "env": { "mode": "entry", "target...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.9
entry.summary:
Legacy decorator (#421)

You can now use decorators from typescrip. You don't need to configure anything. However, decorators on object are not supported yet and I don't think it worth as making parser to accept obsolute syntax may result in bugs.

Als...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.8
entry.summary:
Optional Chaining (#525)

As this is stage 4, it's automatically enabled.

You can write code like

a?.b?.c;

in ecmascript too. Previously it was possible only in typescript.

Nullish coalescing (#526)

As this is stage 3, you need to set jsc.parser.null...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.7
entry.summary:
Statement Expression type (#512)

NOTE: Although this is a technically breaking change, I decided not to bump major version as I don't think someone has created a plugin which depends on exact type of an expression statement.

swc now stores expression...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.6
entry.summary:
performance of transforms

Overall performance of transform passes are improved, thanks to hygiene optimization. Especially, performance of resolver pass is drastically (~60%) improved.

typescript parser bugfix (#507)

There was a bug which sets target...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.5
entry.summary:
dynamic import with es3 target

Previously, swc converts import() to _import() as import is a keyword in es3. But, as import() can be stripped out in many way, swc now emits import if jsc.parser.dynamicImport is true.

script parser

Previously, swc onl...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.4
entry.summary:
loose mode

swc now has a loose mode, just like babel 2015 transform. See doc for more detail.

Lots of bug fix (#489)

I copied almost all tests from babel, and fixed lots of bugs.

resolver pass

Resolver pass, along with hygiene and fixer, is core of t...

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.3
entry.summary:
try catch(#483

swc now handles catch parameter properly.

Typescript enum (#486)

Previously, code generated for typescript enums with initializers was wrong. From now, valid code is generated.

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.2
entry.summary:
Fixed a parser bug (#480)

Previously, swc's parser incorrectly parsed 1.09 as 1.9. swc now parses it correctly.

Preserve space in jsx (#481)

Previousely,

const a = <span> {foo}</span>;

entry.title: Changelog: swc v1.1.1
entry.summary:
TypeScript enum

There was a bug related to typescript enum. I guess many compilation errors came from this.

From now, typescript enums work exactly same as enums compiled with babel.

entry.title: Announcing swc v1.1.0
entry.summary:
Plugin

swc now supports custom plugins written in javascript and friends! Note that .d.ts file for ast nodes and Visitor is provided.

Performance

entry.title: Introducing swc 1.0
entry.summary:
Introduction

What is swc?

swc(speedy web compiler) is a super-fast javascript to javascript compiler.

What can swc do?

It can transpile typescript / jsx / ecmascript 2019 to browser-compatible javascript.

input.js:

class Foo { set foo(v) {} } class B...
